thread.title: NHL roundup: Islanders fall to 0-2 with loss in Chicago
thread.title_full: NHL roundup: Islanders fall to 0-2 with loss in Chicago

title: NHL roundup: Islanders fall to 0-2 with loss in Chicago
text:
NHL roundup: Islanders fall to 0-2 with loss in Chicago October 11, 2015 Last updated: Sunday, October 11, 2015, 1:21 AM THE ASSOCIATED PRESS | Print 
One night after spoiling the Islanders' Brooklyn debut, the Blackhawks knocked off New York again in the second half of the home-and-home series. 
Patrick Kane and rookie Artemi Panarin each had a goal and two assists, and Chicago beat the Islanders, 4-1, on Saturday night at United Center. 
Defenseman Trevor van Riemsdyk, a Middletown native, added his first career NHL goal as the Blackhawks cruised to their first home win. Chicago beat the Islanders, 3-2, in overtime Friday. 
Scott Darling made 28 saves for the Blackhawks in his first start of the season. He was working on a shutout before Cal Clutterbuck got a short-handed goal with 1:05 left. 
PANTHERS 7, FLYERS 1 (at Sunrise, Fla.) — Jaromir Jagr and Reilly Smith each scored twice and Vincent Trocheck had a goal and three assists in Florida's season-opening victory. 
LIGHTNING 4, SABRES 1 (at Buffalo) — Steven Stamkos scored his first goal of the season, helping Tampa Bay. Ben Bishop had 24 saves in the victory. 
SENATORS 5, MAPLE LEAFS 4, SO (at Toronto) — Mike Hoffman had the decisive goal in the season's first shootout, lifting Ottawa. 
CANADIENS 4, BRUINS 2 (at Boston) — Lars Eller scored two goals and Alex Galchenyuk had three assists for Montreal. 
RED WINGS 4, HURRICANES 3 (at Raleigh, N.C.) — Teemu Pulkkinen scored two goals in the third period, leading Detroit. 
WILD 3, BLUES 2 (at St. Paul, Minn.) — Charlie Coyle scored twice, including 21 seconds after a power-play goal by Zach Parise late in the second period, and Minnesota held on. 
PREDATORS 2, OILERS 0 (at Nashville) — Pekka Rinne made 31 saves to lead Nashville. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
